summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2019 between attorney Gloria Allred and federal prosecutors/FBI regarding a new alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails coordinate logistics for the victim to attend an FBI Victim Services meeting in New York and be interviewed by authorities, highlighting ongoing victim outreach and investigation efforts after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: High-profile attorney communicating with the U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI to arrange for a new client, an alleged Epstein victim, to attend a victim meeting and be interviewed.

persons.name: Daniel
persons.context: Mentioned as joining a scheduled conference call regarding the victim case.

persons.name: Marianne Wang
persons.context: Attorney whose office (via Daniel) is involved in the case coordination call.

connections.description: Daniel from co-counsel Marianne Wang's office is scheduled to join a conference call with Allred regarding the victim case.
Allred references Marianne Wang as co-counsel, with Daniel joining from Wang's office.

events.title: FBI Victim Services Meeting in New York
events.description: A meeting organized by the FBI's Victim Services for alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein. Gloria Allred's new client was willing to fly to New York to attend.

events.title: Scheduled Interview/Conference Call
events.description: A planned 4:00 PM call between Gloria Allred, her client, the U.S. Attorney's Office, and the FBI to discuss the new alleged victim case. Scheduling conflicts required coordination.

locations: Los Angeles, CA (6300 Wilshire Blvd., Suite 1500)
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY (Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: Gloria Allred, a prominent attorney, was actively representing a new alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein in October 2019, after Epstein's death.
The FBI's Victim Services division was organizing a meeting for Epstein victims in New York on October 23, 2019, and was handling travel logistics for victims.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and the FBI were coordinating with Allred to interview her new client as part of the ongoing investigation.
The email chain shows detailed logistical planning for victim interviews, indicating continued law enforcement activity related to the Epstein case at that time.
Multiple names of prosecutors and FBI agents are redacted in the document, indicating their involvement but protecting their identities in the public release.
